title: metamorphoses
text: You, gods, since you are the ones who alter these, and all other things, inspire my attempt, and spin out a continuous thread of words, from the world's first origins to my own time

title: metamorphoses
text: Before there was earth or sea or the sky that covers everything, Nature appeared the same throughout the whole world: what we call chaos: a raw confused mass, nothing but inert matter, badly combined discordant atoms of things, confused in the one place

title: metamorphoses
text: There was no Titan yet, shining his light on the world, or waxing Phoebe renewing her white horns, or the earth hovering in surrounding air balanced by her own weight, or watery Amphitrite stretching out her arms along the vast shores of the world

title: metamorphoses
text: Though there was land and sea and air, it was unstable land, unswimmable water, air needing light

title: metamorphoses
text: Nothing retained its shape, one thing obstructed another, because in the one body, cold fought with heat, moist with dry, soft with hard, and weight with weightless things

title: metamorphoses
text: This conflict was ended by a god and a greater order of nature, since he split off the earth from the sky, and the sea from the land, and divided the transparent heavens from the dense air

title: metamorphoses
text: When he had disentangled the elements, and freed them from the obscure mass, he fixed them in separate spaces in harmonious peace

text: The weightless fire, that forms the heavens, darted upwards to make its home in the furthest heights

text: Next came air in lightness and place

text: Earth, heavier than either of these, drew down the largest elements, and was compressed by its own weight

title: metamorphoses
text: When whichever god it was had ordered and divided the mass, and collected it into separate parts, he first gathered the earth into a great ball so that it was uniform on all sides

title: metamorphoses
text: Then he ordered the seas to spread and rise in waves in the flowing winds and pour around the coasts of the encircled land

title: metamorphoses
text: He added springs and standing pools and lakes, and contained in shelving banks the widely separated rivers, some of which are swallowed by the earth itself, others of which reach the sea and entering the expanse of open waters beat against coastlines instead of riverbanks

title: metamorphoses
text: He ordered the plains to extend, the valleys to subside, leaves to hide the trees, stony mountains to rise: and just as the heavens are divided into two zones to the north and two to the south, with a fifth and hotter between them, so the god carefully marked out the enclosed matter with the same number, and described as many regions on the earth

title: metamorphoses
text: The equatorial zone is too hot to be habitable; the two poles are covered by deep snow; and he placed two regions between and gave them a temperate climate mixing heat and cold

title: metamorphoses

text: But she flees swifter than the lightest breath of air, and resists his words calling her back again

title: metamorphoses
text: ‘Wait nymph, daughter of Peneus, I beg you! I who am chasing you am not your enemy

title: metamorphoses
text: Nymph, Wait! This is the way a sheep runs from the wolf, a deer from the mountain lion, and a dove with fluttering wings flies from the eagle: everything flies from its foes, but it is love that is driving me to follow you! Pity me! I am afraid you might fall headlong or thorns undeservedly scar your legs and I be a cause of grief to you! These are rough places you run through

title: metamorphoses
text: Slow down, I ask you, check your flight, and I too will slow

title: metamorphoses
text: At least enquire whom it is you have charmed

title: metamorphoses
text: I am no mountain man, no shepherd, no rough guardian of the herds and flocks

title: metamorphoses
text: Rash girl, you do not know, you cannot realise, who you run from, and so you run

title: metamorphoses
text: Delphi’s lands are mine, Claros and Tenedos, and Patara acknowledges me king

title: metamorphoses
text: Jupiter is my father

title: metamorphoses
text: Through me what was, what is, and what will be, are revealed

title: metamorphoses
text: Through me strings sound in harmony, to song

title: metamorphoses
text: My aim is certain, but an arrow truer than mine, has wounded my free heart! The whole world calls me the bringer of aid; medicine is my invention; my power is in herbs

title: metamorphoses
text: But love cannot be healed by any herb, nor can the arts that cure others cure their lord!’

title: metamorphoses
text: He would have said more as timid Peneïs ran, still lovely to see, leaving him with his words unfinished

title: metamorphoses
text: The winds bared her body, the opposing breezes in her way fluttered her clothes, and the light airs threw her streaming hair behind her, her beauty enhanced by flight

title: metamorphoses
text: But the young god could no longer waste time on further blandishments, urged on by Amor, he ran on at full speed

title: metamorphoses
text: Like a hound of Gaul starting a hare in an empty field, that heads for its prey, she for safety: he, seeming about to clutch her, thinks now, or now, he has her fast, grazing her heels with his outstretched jaws, while she uncertain whether she is already caught, escaping his bite, spurts from the muzzle touching her

title: metamorphoses
text: So the virgin and the god: he driven by desire, she by fear

title: metamorphoses
text: He ran faster, Amor giving him wings, and allowed her no rest, hung on her fleeing shoulders, breathed on the hair flying round her neck

title: metamorphoses
text: Her strength was gone, she grew pale, overcome by the effort of her rapid flight, and seeing Peneus’s waters near cried out ‘Help me father! If your streams have divine powers change me, destroy this beauty that pleases too well!’ Her prayer was scarcely done when a heavy numbness seized her limbs, thin bark closed over her breast, her hair turned into leaves, her arms into branches, her feet so swift a moment ago stuck fast in slow-growing roots, her face was lost in the canopy

title: metamorphoses
text: Only her shining beauty was left

title: metamorphoses
text: Even like this Phoebus loved her and, placing his hand against the trunk, he felt her heart still quivering under the new bark

title: metamorphoses
text: He clasped the branches as if they were parts of human arms, and kissed the wood

title: metamorphoses
text: But even the wood shrank from his kisses, and the god said ‘Since you cannot be my bride, you must be my tree! Laurel, with you my hair will be wreathed, with you my lyre, with you my quiver

title: metamorphoses
text: You will go with the Roman generals when joyful voices acclaim their triumph, and the Capitol witnesses their long processions

title: metamorphoses
text: You will stand outside Augustus’s doorposts, a faithful guardian, and keep watch over the crown of oak between them

title: metamorphoses
text: And just as my head with its un-cropped hair is always young, so you also will wear the beauty of undying leaves

title: metamorphoses
text: ’ Paean had done: the laurel bowed her newly made branches, and seemed to shake her leafy crown like a head giving consent

title: metamorphoses
text: There is a grove in Haemonia, closed in on every side by wooded cliffs

title: metamorphoses
text: They call it Tempe

title: metamorphoses
text: Through it the river Peneus rolls, with foaming waters, out of the roots of Pindus, and in its violent fall gathers clouds, driving the smoking mists along, raining down spray onto the tree tops, and deafening remoter places with its roar

title: metamorphoses
text: Here is the house, the home, the innermost sanctuary of the great river

title: metamorphoses
text: Seated here, in a rocky cavern, he laid down the law to the waters and the nymphs who lived in his streams

title: metamorphoses
text: Here the rivers of his own country first met, unsure whether to console or celebrate with Daphne’s father: Spercheus among poplars, restless Enipeus, gentle Amphrysus, Aeas and ancient Apidanus; and then later all the others that, whichever way their force carries them, bring down their weary wandering waters to the sea

title: metamorphoses
text: Only Inachus is missing, but hidden in the deepest cave he swells his stream with tears, and in utter misery laments his lost daughter, Io, not knowing if she is alive or among the shades

title: metamorphoses
text: Since he cannot find her anywhere, he imagines her nowhere, and his heart fears worse than death

title: metamorphoses
text: Jupiter first saw her returning from her father’s stream, and said ‘Virgin, worthy of Jupiter himself, who will make some unknown man happy when you share his bed, while it is hot and the sun is at the highest point of its arc, find shade in the deep woods! (And he showed her the woods’ shade)

title: metamorphoses
text: But if you are afraid to enter the wild beasts’ lairs, you can go into the remote woods in safety, protected by a god, and not by any lesser god, but by the one who holds the sceptre of heaven in his mighty hand, and who hurls the flickering bolts of lightning

title: metamorphoses
text: Do not fly from me!’ She was already in flight

title: metamorphoses
text: She had left behind Lerna’s pastures, and the Lyrcean plain’s wooded fields, when the god hid the wide earth in a covering of fog, caught the fleeing girl, and raped her

title: metamorphoses
text: Meanwhile Juno looked down into the heart of Argos, surprised that rapid mists had created night in shining daylight

title: metamorphoses
text: She knew they were not vapours from the river, or breath from the damp earth

title: metamorphoses
text: She looked around to see where her husband was, knowing by now the intrigues of a spouse so often caught in the act

title: metamorphoses
text: When she could not find him in the skies, she said ‘Either I am wrong, or being wronged’ and gliding down from heaven’s peak, she stood on earth ordering the clouds to melt

title: metamorphoses
text: Jupiter had a presage of his wife’s arrival and had changed Inachus’s daughter into a gleaming heifer

title: metamorphoses
text: Even in that form she was beautiful

title: metamorphoses
text: Saturnia approved the animal’s looks, though grudgingly, asking, then, whose she was, where from, what herd, as if she did not know

title: metamorphoses
text: Jupiter, to stop all inquiry, lied, saying she had been born from the earth

title: metamorphoses
text: Then Saturnia claimed her as a gift

title: metamorphoses
text: What could he do? Cruel to sacrifice his love, but suspicious not to

title: metamorphoses
text: Shame urges him to it, Amor urges not

title: metamorphoses
text: Amor would have conquered Shame, but if he refused so slight a gift as a heifer to the companion of his race and bed, it might appear no heifer!

title: metamorphoses
text: Though her rival was given up the goddess did not abandon her fears at once, cautious of Jupiter and afraid of his trickery, until she had given Io into Argus’s keeping, that son of Arestor

title: metamorphoses
text: Argus had a hundred eyes round his head, that took their rest two at a time in succession while the others kept watch and stayed on guard

title: metamorphoses
text: Wherever he stood he was looking at Io, and had Io in front of his eyes when his back was turned

title: metamorphoses
text: He let her graze in the light, but when the sun sank below the earth, he penned her, and fastened a rope round her innocent neck

title: metamorphoses
text: She grazed on the leaves of trees and bitter herbs

title: metamorphoses
text: She often lay on the bare ground, and the poor thing drank water from muddy streams

title: metamorphoses
text: When she wished to stretch her arms out to Argus in supplication, she had no arms to stretch

title: metamorphoses
text: Trying to complain, a lowing came from her mouth, and she was alarmed and frightened by the sound of her own voice

title: metamorphoses
text: When she came to Inachus’s riverbanks where she often used to play and saw her gaping mouth and her new horns in the water, she grew frightened and fled terrified of herself

title: metamorphoses
text: The naiads did not know her: Inachus himself did not know her, but she followed her father, followed her sisters, allowing herself to be petted, and offering herself to be admired

title: metamorphoses
text: Old Inachus pulled some grasses and held them out to her: she licked her father’s hand and kissed his palm, could not hold back her tears, and if only words could have come she would have begged for help, telling her name and her distress

title: metamorphoses
text: With letters drawn in the dust with her hoof, instead of words, she traced the sad story of her changed form

title: metamorphoses
text: ‘Pity me!’ said her father Inachus, clinging to the groaning heifer’s horns and snow-white neck, ‘Pity me!’ he sighed; ‘Are you really my daughter I searched the wide world for? There was less sadness with you lost than found! Without speech, you do not answer in words to mine, only heave deep sighs from your breast, and all you can do is low in reply to me

title: metamorphoses
text: Unknowingly I was arranging marriage and a marriage-bed for you, hoping for a son-in-law first and then grandchildren

title: metamorphoses
text: Now you must find a mate from the herd, and from the herd get you a son

title: metamorphoses
text: I am not allowed by dying to end such sorrow; it is hard to be a god, the door of death closed to me, my grief goes on immortal for ever

title: metamorphoses
text: ’ As he mourned, Argus with his star-like eyes drove her to distant pastures, dragging her out of her father’s arms

title: metamorphoses
text: There, sitting at a distance he occupied a high peak of the mountain, where resting he could keep a watch on every side

title: metamorphoses
text: Now the king of the gods can no longer stand Phoronis’s great sufferings, and he calls his son, born of the shining Pleiad, and orders him to kill Argus

title: metamorphoses
text: Mercury, quickly puts on his winged sandals, takes his sleep-inducing wand in his divine hand, and sets his cap on his head

title: metamorphoses
text: Dressed like this the son of Jupiter touches down on the earth from his father’s stronghold

title: metamorphoses
text: There, he takes off his cap, and doffs his wings, only keeping his wand

title: metamorphoses
text: Taking this, disguised as a shepherd, he drives she-goats, stolen on the way, through solitary lanes, and plays his reed pipe as he goes

title: metamorphoses
text: Juno’s guard is captivated by this new sound

title: metamorphoses
text: ‘You there, whoever you are’ Argus calls ‘you could sit here beside me on this rock; there’s no better grass elsewhere for your flock, and you can see that the shade is fine for shepherds

title: metamorphoses
text: The descendant of Atlas sits down, and passes the day in conversation, talking of many things, and playing on his reed pipe, trying to conquer those watching eyes

title: metamorphoses
text: Argus however fights to overcome gentle sleep, and though he allows some of his eyes to close, the rest stay vigilant

title: metamorphoses
text: He even asks, since the reed pipe has only just been invented, how it was invented

title: metamorphoses
text: So the god explained ‘On Arcadia’s cold mountain slopes among the wood nymphs, the hamadryads, of Mount Nonacris, one was the most celebrated: the nymphs called her Syrinx

title: metamorphoses
text: She had often escaped from the satyrs chasing her, and from others of the demi-gods that live in shadowy woods and fertile fields

title: metamorphoses
text: But she followed the worship of the Ortygian goddess in staying virgin

title: metamorphoses
text: Her dress caught up like Diana she deceives the eye, and could be mistaken for Leto’s daughter, except that her bow is of horn, and the other’s is of gold

title: metamorphoses
text: Even so she is deceptive

title: metamorphoses
text: Pan, whose head is crowned with a wreath of sharp pine shoots, saw her, coming from Mount Lycaeus, and spoke to her

title: metamorphoses
text: ’ Now Mercury still had to relate what Pan said, and how the nymph, despising his entreaties, ran through the wilds till she came to the calm waters of sandy Ladon; and how when the river stopped her flight she begged her sisters of the stream to change her; and how Pan, when he thought he now had Syrinx, found that instead of the nymph’s body he only held reeds from the marsh; and, while he sighed there, the wind in the reeds, moving, gave out a clear, plaintive sound

title: metamorphoses
text: Charmed by this new art and its sweet tones the god said ‘This way of communing with you is still left to me

title: metamorphoses
text: ’ So unequal lengths of reed, joined together with wax, preserved the girl’s name

title: metamorphoses
text: About to tell all this, Cyllenian Mercury saw that every eye had succumbed and their light was lost in sleep

title: metamorphoses
text: Quickly he stops speaking and deepens their rest, caressing those drowsy eyes with touches of his magic wand

title: metamorphoses
text: Then straightaway he strikes the nodding head, where it joins the neck, with his curved sword, and sends it bloody down the rocks, staining the steep cliff

title: metamorphoses
text: Argus, you are overthrown, the light of your many eyes is extinguished, and one dark sleeps under so many eyelids

title: metamorphoses
text: Saturnia took his eyes and set them into the feathers of her own bird, and filled the tail with star-like jewels

title: metamorphoses
text: Immediately she blazed with anger, and did not hold back from its consequences

title: metamorphoses
text: She set a terrifying Fury in front of the eyes and mind of that ‘slut’ from the Argolis, buried a tormenting restlessness in her breast, and drove her as a fugitive through the world

title: metamorphoses
text: You, Nile, put an end to her immeasurable suffering

title: metamorphoses
text: When she reached you, she fell forward onto her knees on the riverbank and turning back her long neck with her face upwards, in the only way she could, looked to the sky, and with groans and tears and sad lowing seemed to reproach Jupiter and beg him to end her troubles

title: metamorphoses
text: Jupiter threw his arms round his wife’s neck and pleaded for an end to vengeance, saying ‘Do not fear, in future she will never be a source of pain’ and he called the Stygian waters to witness his words

title: metamorphoses
text: As the goddess grows calmer, Io regains her previous appearance, and becomes what she once was

title: metamorphoses
text: The rough hair leaves her body, the horns disappear, the great eyes grow smaller, the gaping mouth shrinks, the shoulders and hands return, and the hooves vanish, each hoof changing back into five nails

title: metamorphoses
text: Nothing of the heifer is left except her whiteness

title: metamorphoses
text: Able to stand on two feet she raises herself erect and fearing to speak in case she lows like a heifer, timidly attempts long neglected words

title: metamorphoses
text: Now she is worshipped as a greatly honoured goddess by crowds of linen clad acolytes

title: metamorphoses
text: In due time she bore a son, Epaphus, who shared the cities’ temples with his mother, and was believed to have been conceived from mighty Jupiter’s seed

title: metamorphoses
text: He had a friend, Phaethon, child of the Sun, equal to him in spirit and years, who once boasted proudly that Phoebus was his father, and refused to concede the claim, which Inachus’s grandson could not accept

title: metamorphoses
text: ‘You are mad to believe all your mother says, and you have an inflated image of your father

title: metamorphoses
text: ’ Phaethon reddened but, from shame, repressed his anger, and went to his mother Clymene with Inachus’s reproof

title: metamorphoses
text: ‘To sadden you more, mother, I the free, proud, spirit was silent! I am ashamed that such a reproach can be spoken and not answered

title: metamorphoses
text: But if I am born at all of divine stock, give me some proof of my high birth, and let me claim my divinity!’ So saying he flung his arms round his mother’s neck, entreating her, by his own and her husband Merops’s life, and by his sisters’ marriages, to reveal to him some true sign of his parentage

title: metamorphoses
text: Clymene, moved perhaps by Phaethon’s entreaties or more by anger at the words spoken, stretched both arms out to the sky and looking up at the sun’s glow said ‘By that brightness marked out by glittering rays, that sees us and hears us, I swear to you, my son, that you are the child of the Sun; of that being you see; you are the child of he who governs the world; if I lie, may he himself decline to look on me again, and may this be the last light to reach our eyes! It is no great effort for you yourself to find your father’s house

title: metamorphoses
text: The place he rises from is near our land

title: metamorphoses
text: If you have it in mind to do so, go and ask the sun himself!’ Immediately Phaethon, delighted at his mother’s words, imagining the heavens in his mind, darts off and crosses Ethiopia his people’s land, then India, land of those bathed in radiant fire, and with energy reaches the East

title: metamorphoses
text: The palace of the Sun towered up with raised columns, bright with glittering gold, and gleaming bronze like fire

title: metamorphoses
text: Shining ivory crowned the roofs, and the twin doors radiated light from polished silver

title: metamorphoses
text: The work of art was finer than the material: on the doors Mulciber had engraved the waters that surround the earth’s centre, the earthly globe, and the overarching sky

title: metamorphoses
text: The dark blue sea contains the gods, melodious Triton, shifting Proteus, Aegaeon crushing two huge whales together, his arms across their backs, and Doris with her daughters, some seen swimming, some sitting on rocks drying their sea-green hair, some riding the backs of fish

title: metamorphoses
text: They are neither all alike, nor all different, just as sisters should be

title: metamorphoses
text: The land shows men and towns, woods and creatures, rivers and nymphs and other rural gods

title: metamorphoses
text: Above them was an image of the glowing sky, with six signs of the zodiac on the right hand door and the same number on the left

title: metamorphoses
text: As soon as Clymene’s son had climbed the steep path there, and entered the house of this parent of whose relationship to himself he was uncertain, he immediately made his way into his father’s presence, but stopped some way off, unable to bear his light too close

title: metamorphoses
text: Wearing a purple robe, Phoebus sat on a throne shining with bright emeralds

title: metamorphoses
text: To right and left stood the Day, Month, and Year, the Century and the equally spaced Hours

title: metamorphoses
text: Young Spring stood there circled with a crown of flowers, naked Summer wore a garland of ears of corn, Autumn was stained by the trodden grapes, and icy Winter had white, bristling hair

title: metamorphoses
text: The Sun, seated in the middle of them, looked at the boy, who was fearful of the strangeness of it all, with eyes that see everything, and said ‘What reason brings you here? What do you look for on these heights, Phaethon, son that no father need deny?’ Phaethon replied ‘Universal light of the great world, Phoebus, father, if you let me use that name, if Clymene is not hiding some fault behind false pretence, give me proof father, so they will believe I am your true offspring, and take away this uncertainty from my mind!’ He spoke, and his father removed the crown of glittering rays from his head and ordered him to come nearer

title: metamorphoses
text: Embracing him, he said ‘It is not to be denied you are worthy to be mine, and Clymene has told you the truth of your birth

title: metamorphoses
text: So that you can banish doubt, ask for any favour, so that I can grant it to you

title: metamorphoses
text: May the Stygian lake, that my eyes have never seen, by which the gods swear, witness my promise

title: metamorphoses
text: ’ Hardly had he settled back properly in his seat when the boy asked for his father’s chariot and the right to control his wing-footed horses for a day

title: metamorphoses
text: His father regretted his oath

title: metamorphoses
text: Three times, and then a fourth, shaking his bright head, he said ‘Your words show mine were rash; if only it were right to retract my promise! I confess my boy I would only refuse you this one thing

title: metamorphoses
text: It is right to dissuade you

title: metamorphoses
text: What you want is unsafe

title: metamorphoses
text: Phaethon you ask too great a favour, and one that is unfitting for your strength and boyish years

title: metamorphoses
text: Your fate is mortal: it is not mortal what you ask

title: metamorphoses
text: Unknowingly you aspire to more than the gods can share

title: metamorphoses
text: Though each deity can please themselves, within what is allowed, no one except myself has the power to occupy the chariot of fire

title: metamorphoses
text: Even the lord of mighty Olympus, who hurls terrifying lightning-bolts from his right hand, cannot drive this team, and who is greater than Jupiter?’

title: metamorphoses
text: ‘The first part of the track is steep, and one that my fresh horses at dawn can hardly climb

title: metamorphoses
text: In mid-heaven it is highest, where to look down on earth and sea often alarms even me, and makes my heart tremble with awesome fear

title: metamorphoses
text: The last part of the track is downwards and needs sure control

title: metamorphoses
text: Then even Tethys herself, who receives me in her submissive waves, is accustomed to fear that I might dive headlong

title: metamorphoses
text: Moreover the rushing sky is constantly turning, and drags along the remote stars, and whirls them in rapid orbits

title: metamorphoses
text: I move the opposite way, and its momentum does not overcome me as it does all other things, and I ride contrary to its swift rotation

title: metamorphoses
text: Suppose you are given the chariot

title: metamorphoses
text: What will you do? Will you be able to counter the turning poles so that the swiftness of the skies does not carry you away? Perhaps you conceive in imagination that there are groves there and cities of the gods and temples with rich gifts

title: metamorphoses
text: The way runs through ambush, and apparitions of wild beasts! Even if you keep your course, and do not steer awry, you must still avoid the horns of Taurus the Bull, Sagittarius the Haemonian Archer, raging Leo and the Lion’s jaw, Scorpio’s cruel pincers sweeping out to encircle you from one side, and Cancer’s crab-claws reaching out from the other

title: metamorphoses
text: You will not easily rule those proud horses, breathing out through mouth and nostrils the fires burning in their chests

title: metamorphoses
text: They scarcely tolerate my control when their fierce spirits are hot, and their necks resist the reins

title: metamorphoses
text: Beware my boy, that I am not the source of a gift fatal to you, while something can still be done to set right your request!’

title: metamorphoses
text: ‘No doubt, since you ask for a certain sign to give you confidence in being born of my blood, I give you that sure sign by fearing for you, and show myself a father by fatherly anxiety

title: metamorphoses
text: Look at me

title: metamorphoses
text: If only you could look into my heart, and see a father’s concern from within! Finally, look around you, at the riches the world holds, and ask for anything from all of the good things in earth, sea, and sky

title: metamorphoses
text: I can refuse you nothing

title: metamorphoses
text: Only this one thing I take exception to, which would truly be a punishment and not an honour

title: metamorphoses
text: Phaethon, you ask for punishment as your reward! Why do you unknowingly throw your coaxing arms around my neck? Have no doubt! Whatever you ask will be given, I have sworn it by the Stygian streams, but make a wiser choice!’

title: metamorphoses
text: The warning ended, but Phaethon still rejected his words, and pressed his purpose, blazing with desire to drive the chariot

title: metamorphoses
text: So, as he had the right, his father led the youth to the high chariot, Vulcan’s work

title: metamorphoses
text: It had an axle of gold, and a gold chariot pole, wheels with golden rims, and circles of silver spokes

title: metamorphoses
text: Along the yoke chrysolites and gemstones, set in order, glowed with brilliance reflecting Phoebus’s own light

title: metamorphoses
text: Now while brave Phaethon is gazing in wonder at the workmanship, see, Aurora, awake in the glowing east, opens wide her bright doors, and her rose-filled courts

title: metamorphoses
text: The stars, whose ranks are shepherded by Lucifer the morning star, vanish, and he, last of all, leaves his station in the sky

title: metamorphoses
text: When Titan saw his setting, as the earth and skies were reddening, and just as the crescent of the vanishing moon faded, he ordered the swift Hours to yoke his horses

title: metamorphoses
text: The goddesses quickly obeyed his command, and led the team, sated with ambrosial food and breathing fire, out of the tall stables, and put on their ringing harness

title: metamorphoses
text: Then the father rubbed his son’s face with a sacred ointment, and made it proof against consuming flames, and placed his rays amongst his hair, and foreseeing tragedy, and fetching up sighs from his troubled heart, said ‘If you can at least obey your father’s promptings, spare the whip, boy, and rein them in more strongly! They run swiftly of their own accord

title: metamorphoses
text: It is a hard task to check their eagerness

title: metamorphoses
text: And do not please yourself, taking a path straight through the five zones of heaven! The track runs obliquely in a wide curve, and bounded by the three central regions, avoids the southern pole and the Arctic north

title: metamorphoses
text: This is your road, you will clearly see my wheel-marks, and so that heaven and earth receive equal warmth, do not sink down too far or heave the chariot into the upper air! Too high and you will scorch the roof of heaven: too low, the earth

title: metamorphoses
text: The middle way is safest

title: metamorphoses
text: Nor must you swerve too far right towards writhing Serpens, nor lead your wheels too far left towards sunken Ara

title: metamorphoses
text: Hold your way between them! I leave the rest to Fortune, I pray she helps you, and takes better care of you than you do yourself

title: metamorphoses
text: While I have been speaking, dewy night has touched her limit on Hesperus’s far western shore

title: metamorphoses
text: We have no time for freedom! We are needed: Aurora, the dawn, shines, and the shadows are gone

title: metamorphoses
text: Seize the reins in your hand, or if your mind can be changed, take my counsel, do not take my horses! While you can, while you still stand on solid ground, before unknowingly you take to the chariot you have unluckily chosen, let me light the world, while you watch in safety!

title: metamorphoses
text: The boy has already taken possession of the fleet chariot, and stands proudly, and joyfully, takes the light reins in his hands, and thanks his unwilling father

title: metamorphoses
text: Meanwhile the sun’s swift horses, Pyroïs, Eoüs, Aethon, and the fourth, Phlegon, fill the air with fiery whinnying, and strike the bars with their hooves

title: metamorphoses
text: When Tethys, ignorant of her grandson’s fate, pushed back the gate, and gave them access to the wide heavens, rushing out, they tore through the mists in the way with their hooves and, lifted by their wings, overtook the East winds rising from the same region

title: metamorphoses
text: But the weight was lighter than the horses of the Sun could feel, and the yoke was free of its accustomed load

title: metamorphoses
text: Just as curved-sided boats rock in the waves without their proper ballast, and being too light are unstable at sea, so the chariot, free of its usual burden, leaps in the air and rushes into the heights as though it were empty

title: metamorphoses
text: As soon as they feel this the team of four run wild and leave the beaten track, no longer running in their pre-ordained course

title: metamorphoses
text: He was terrified, unable to handle the reins entrusted to him, not knowing where the track was, nor, if he had known, how to control the team

title: metamorphoses
text: Then for the first time the chill stars of the Great and Little Bears, grew hot, and tried in vain to douse themselves in forbidden waters

title: metamorphoses
text: And the Dragon, Draco, that is nearest to the frozen pole, never formidable before and sluggish with the cold, now glowed with heat, and took to seething with new fury

title: metamorphoses
text: They say that you Bootës also fled in confusion, slow as you are and hampered by the Plough

title: metamorphoses
text: When the unlucky Phaethon looked down from the heights of the sky at the earth far, far below he grew pale and his knees quaked with sudden fear, and his eyes were robbed of shadow by the excess light

title: metamorphoses
text: Now he would rather he had never touched his father’s horses, and regrets knowing his true parentage and possessing what he asked for

title: metamorphoses
text: Now he wants only to be called Merops’s son, as he is driven along like a ship in a northern gale, whose master lets go the ropes, and leaves her to prayer and the gods

title: metamorphoses
text: What can he do? Much of the sky is now behind his back, but more is before his eyes

title: metamorphoses
text: Measuring both in his mind, he looks ahead to the west he is not fated to reach and at times back to the east

title: metamorphoses
text: Dazed he is ignorant how to act, and can neither grasp the reins nor has the power to loose them, nor can he change course by calling the horses by name

title: metamorphoses
text: Also, alarmed, he sees the marvellous forms of huge creatures everywhere in the glowing sky

title: metamorphoses
text: There is a place where Scorpio bends his pincers in twin arcs, and, with his tail and his curving arms stretched out to both sides, spreads his body and limbs over two star signs

title: metamorphoses
text: When the boy saw this monster drenched with black and poisonous venom threatening to wound him with its arched sting, robbed of his wits by chilling horror, he dropped the reins

title: metamorphoses
text: When the horses feel the reins lying across their backs, after he has thrown them down, they veer off course and run unchecked through unknown regions of the air

title: metamorphoses
text: Wherever their momentum takes them there they run, lawlessly, striking against the fixed stars in deep space and hurrying the chariot along remote tracks

title: metamorphoses
text: Now they climb to the heights of heaven, now rush headlong down its precipitous slope, sweeping a course nearer to the earth

title: metamorphoses
text: The Moon, amazed, sees her brother’s horses running below her own, and the boiling clouds smoke

title: metamorphoses
text: The earth bursts into flame, in the highest regions first, opens in deep fissures and all its moisture dries up

title: metamorphoses
text: The meadows turn white, the trees are consumed with all their leaves, and the scorched corn makes its own destruction

title: metamorphoses
text: But I am bemoaning the lesser things

title: metamorphoses
text: Great cities are destroyed with all their walls, and the flames reduce whole nations with all their peoples to ashes

title: metamorphoses
text: The woodlands burn, with the hills

title: metamorphoses
text: Mount Athos is on fire, Cilician Taurus, Tmolus, Oete and Ida, dry now once covered with fountains, and Helicon home of the Muses, and Haemus not yet linked with King Oeagrius’s name

title: metamorphoses
text: Etna blazes with immense redoubled flames, the twin peaks of Parnassus, Eryx, Cynthus, Othrys, Rhodope fated at last to lose its snow, Mimas and Dindyma, Mycale and Cithaeron, ancient in rites

title: metamorphoses
text: Its chilly climate cannot save Scythia

title: metamorphoses
text: The Caucasus burn, and Ossa along with Pindus, and Olympos greater than either, and the lofty Alps and cloud-capped Apennines

title: metamorphoses
text: Then, truly, Phaethon sees the whole earth on fire

title: metamorphoses
text: He cannot bear the violent heat, and he breathes the air as if from a deep furnace

title: metamorphoses
text: He feels his chariot glowing white

title: metamorphoses
text: He can no longer stand the ash and sparks flung out, and is enveloped in dense, hot smoke

title: metamorphoses
text: He does not know where he is, or where he is going, swept along by the will of the winged horses

title: metamorphoses
text: It was then, so they believe, that the Ethiopians acquired their dark colour, since the blood was drawn to the surface of their bodies

title: metamorphoses
text: Then Libya became a desert, the heat drying up her moisture

title: metamorphoses
text: Then the nymphs with dishevelled hair wept bitterly for their lakes and fountains

title: metamorphoses
text: Boeotia searches for Dirce’s rills, Argos for Amymone’s fountain, Corinth for the Pirenian spring

title: metamorphoses
text: Nor are the rivers safe because of their wide banks

title: metamorphoses
text: The Don turns to steam in mid-water, and old Peneus, and Mysian Caicus and swift-flowing Ismenus, Arcadian Erymanthus, Xanthus destined to burn again, golden Lycormas and Maeander playing in its watery curves, Thracian Melas and Laconian Eurotas

title: metamorphoses
text: Babylonian Euphrates burns

title: metamorphoses
text: Orontes burns and quick Thermodon, Ganges, Phasis, and Danube

title: metamorphoses
text: Alpheus boils

title: metamorphoses
text: Spercheos’s banks are on fire

title: metamorphoses
text: The gold that the River Tagus carries is molten with the fires, and the swans for whose singing Maeonia’s riverbanks are famous, are scorched in Caÿster’s midst

title: metamorphoses
text: The Nile fled in terror to the ends of the earth, and hid its head that remains hidden

title: metamorphoses
text: Its seven mouths are empty and dust-filled, seven channels without a stream

title: metamorphoses
text: The same fate parches the Thracian rivers, Hebrus and Strymon, and the western rivers, Rhine, Rhone, Po and the Tiber who had been promised universal power

title: metamorphoses
text: Everywhere the ground breaks apart, light penetrates through the cracks down into Tartarus, and terrifies the king of the underworld and his queen

title: metamorphoses
text: The sea contracts and what was a moment ago wide sea is a parched expanse of sand

title: metamorphoses
text: Mountains emerge from the water, and add to the scattered Cyclades

title: metamorphoses
text: The fish dive deep, and the dolphins no longer dare to rise arcing above the water, as they have done, into the air

title: metamorphoses
text: The lifeless bodies of seals float face upwards on the deep

title: metamorphoses
text: They even say that Nereus himself, and Doris and her daughters drifted through warm caves

title: metamorphoses
text: Three times Neptune tried to lift his fierce face and arms above the waters

title: metamorphoses
text: Three times he could not endure the burning air

title: metamorphoses
text: Nevertheless, kindly Earth, surrounded as she was by sea, between the open waters and the dwindling streams that had buried themselves in their mother’s dark womb, lifted her smothered face

title: metamorphoses
text: Putting her hand to her brow, and shaking everything with her mighty tremors, she sank back a little lower than she used to be, and spoke in a faint voice ‘If this pleases you, if I have deserved it, O king of the gods, why delay your lightning bolts? If it is right for me to die through the power of fire, let me die by your fire and let the doer of it lessen the pain of the deed! I can hardly open my lips to say these words’ (the heat was choking her)

title: metamorphoses
text: Look at my scorched hair and the ashes in my eyes, the ashes over my face! Is this the honour and reward you give me for my fruitfulness and service, for carrying wounds from the curved plough and the hoe, for being worked throughout the year, providing herbage and tender grazing for the flocks, produce for the human race and incense to minister to you gods?

title: metamorphoses
text: Even if you find me deserving of ruin, what have the waves done, why does your brother deserve this? Why are the waters that were his share by lot diminished and so much further from the sky? If neither regard for me or for your brother moves you pity at least your own heavens! Look around you on either side: both the poles are steaming! If the fire should melt them, your own palace will fall! Atlas himself is suffering, and can barely hold up the white-hot sky on his shoulders! If the sea and the land and the kingdom of the heavens are destroyed, we are lost in ancient chaos! Save whatever is left from the flames, and think of our common interest!’

title: metamorphoses
text: So the Earth spoke, and unable to tolerate the heat any longer or speak any further, she withdrew her face into her depths closer to the caverns of the dead

title: metamorphoses
text: But the all-powerful father of the gods climbs to the highest summit of heaven, from where he spreads his clouds over the wide earth, from where he moves the thunder and hurls his quivering lightning bolts, calling on the gods, especially on him who had handed over the sun chariot, to witness that, unless he himself helps, the whole world will be overtaken by a ruinous fate

title: metamorphoses
text: Now he has no clouds to cover the earth, or rain to shower from the sky

title: metamorphoses
text: He thundered, and balancing a lightning bolt in his right hand threw it from eye-level at the charioteer, removing him, at the same moment, from the chariot and from life, extinguishing fire with fierce fire

title: metamorphoses
text: Thrown into confusion the horses, lurching in different directions, wrench their necks from the yoke and throw off the broken harness

title: metamorphoses
text: Here the reins lie, there the axle torn from the pole, there the spokes of shattered wheels, and the fragments of the wrecked chariot are flung far and wide

title: metamorphoses
text: But Phaethon, flames ravaging his glowing hair, is hurled headlong, leaving a long trail in the air, as sometimes a star does in the clear sky, appearing to fall although it does not fall

title: metamorphoses
text: Far from his own country, in a distant part of the world, the river god Eridanus takes him from the air, and bathes his smoke-blackened face

title: metamorphoses
text: There the Italian nymphs consign his body, still smoking from that triple-forked flame, to the earth, and they also carve a verse in the rock:

title: metamorphoses
text: HERE PHAETHON LIES WHO THE SUN’S JOURNEY MADE

title: metamorphoses
text: DARED ALL THOUGH HE BY WEAKNESS WAS BETRAYED

title: metamorphoses
text: Now the father, pitiful, ill with grief, hid his face, and, if we can believe it, a whole day went by without the sun

title: metamorphoses
text: But the fires gave light, so there was something beneficial amongst all that evil

title: metamorphoses
text: But Clymene, having uttered whatever can be uttered at such misfortune, grieving and frantic and tearing her breast, wandered over the whole earth first looking for her son’s limbs, and then failing that his bones

title: metamorphoses
text: She found his bones already buried however, beside the riverbank in a foreign country

title: metamorphoses
text: Falling to the ground she bathed with tears the name she could read on the cold stone and warmed it against her naked breast

title: metamorphoses
text: The Heliads, her daughters and the Sun’s, cry no less, and offer their empty tribute of tears to the dead, and, beating their breasts with their hands, they call for their brother night and day, and lie down on his tomb, though he cannot hear their pitiful sighs

title: metamorphoses
text: Four times the moon had joined her crescent horns to form her bright disc

title: metamorphoses
text: They by habit, since use creates habit, devoted themselves to mourning

title: metamorphoses
text: Then Phaethüsa, the eldest sister, when she tried to throw herself to the ground, complained that her ankles had stiffened, and when radiant Lampetia tried to come near her she was suddenly rooted to the spot

title: metamorphoses
text: A third sister attempting to tear at her hair pulled out leaves

title: metamorphoses
text: One cried out in pain that her legs were sheathed in wood, another that her arms had become long branches

title: metamorphoses
text: While they wondered at this, bark closed round their thighs and by degrees over their waists, breasts, shoulders, and hands, and all that was left free were their mouths calling for their mother

title: metamorphoses
text: What can their mother do but go here and there as the impulse takes her, pressing her lips to theirs where she can? It is no good

title: metamorphoses
text: She tries to pull the bark from their bodies and break off new branches with her hands, but drops of blood are left behind like wounds

title: metamorphoses
text: ‘Stop, mother, please’ cries out whichever one she hurts, ‘Please stop: It is my body in the tree you are tearing

title: metamorphoses
text: Now, farewell

title: metamorphoses
text: ’ and the bark closed over her with her last words

title: metamorphoses
text: Their tears still flow, and hardened by the sun, fall as amber from the virgin branches, to be taken by the bright river and sent onwards to adorn Roman brides

title: metamorphoses
text: Cycnus, the son of Sthenelus witnessed this marvel, who though he was kin to you Phaethon, through his mother, was closer still in love

title: metamorphoses
text: Now, though he had ruled the people and great cities of Liguria, he left his kingdom, and filled Eridanus’s green banks and streams, and the woods the sisters had become part of, with his grief

title: metamorphoses
text: As he did so his voice vanished and white feathers hid his hair, his long neck stretched out from his body, his reddened fingers became webbed, wings covered his sides, and a rounded beak his mouth

title: metamorphoses
text: So Cycnus became a new kind of bird, the swan

title: metamorphoses
text: But he had no faith in Jupiter and the heavens, remembering the lightning bolt the god in his severity had hurled

title: metamorphoses
text: He looked for standing water, and open lakes hating fire, choosing to live in floods rather than flames

title: metamorphoses
text: Meanwhile Phaethon’s father, mourning and without his accustomed brightness, as if in eclipse, hated the light, himself and the day

title: metamorphoses
text: He gave his mind over to grief, and to grief added his anger, and refused to provide his service to the earth

title: metamorphoses
text: ‘Enough’ he says ‘since the beginning, my task has given me no rest and I am weary of work without end and labour without honour! Whoever chooses to can steer the chariot of light! If no one does, and all the gods acknowledge they cannot, let Jupiter himself do it, so that for a while at least, while he tries to take the reins, he must put aside the lightning bolts that leave fathers bereft! Then he will know when he has tried the strength of those horses, with hooves of fire, that the one who failed to rule them well did not deserve to be killed

title: metamorphoses
text: All the gods gather round Sol, as he talks like this, and beg him not to shroud everything with darkness

title: metamorphoses
text: Jupiter himself tries to excuse the fire he hurled, adding threats to his entreaties as kings do

title: metamorphoses
text: Then Phoebus rounds up his horses, maddened and still trembling with terror, and in pain lashes out at them with goad and whip (really lashes out) reproaching them and blaming them for his son’s death

title: metamorphoses
text: Now the all-powerful father of the gods circuits the vast walls of heaven and examines them to check if anything has been loosened by the violent fires

title: metamorphoses
text: When he sees they are as solid and robust as ever he inspects the earth and the works of humankind

title: metamorphoses
text: Arcadia above all is his greatest care

title: metamorphoses
text: He restores her fountains and streams, that are still hardly daring to flow, gives grass to the bare earth, leaves to the trees, and makes the scorched forests grow green again

title: metamorphoses
text: Often, as he came and went, he would stop short at the sight of a girl from Nonacris, feeling the fire take in the very marrow of his bones

title: metamorphoses
text: She was not one to spin soft wool or play with her hair

title: metamorphoses
text: A clasp fastened her tunic, and a white ribbon held back her loose tresses

title: metamorphoses
text: Dressed like this, with a spear or a bow in her hand, she was one of Diana’s companions

title: metamorphoses
text: No nymph who roamed Maenalus was dearer to Trivia, goddess of the crossways, than she, Callisto, was

title: metamorphoses
text: But no favour lasts long

title: metamorphoses
text: The sun was high, just path the zenith, when she entered a grove that had been untouched through the years

title: metamorphoses
text: Here she took her quiver from her shoulder, unstrung her curved bow, and lay down on the grass, her head resting on her painted quiver

title: metamorphoses
text: Jupiter, seeing her there weary and unprotected, said ‘Here, surely, my wife will not see my cunning, or if she does find out it is, oh it is, worth a quarrel!’ Quickly he took on the face and dress of Diana, and said ‘Oh, girl who follows me, where in my domains have you been hunting?’

title: metamorphoses
text: The virgin girl got up from the turf replying ‘Greetings, goddess greater than Jupiter: I say it even though he himself hears it

title: metamorphoses
text: ’ He did hear, and laughed, happy to be judged greater than himself, and gave her kisses unrestrainedly, and not those that virgins give

title: metamorphoses
text: When she started to say which woods she had hunted he embraced and prevented her and not without committing a crime

title: metamorphoses
text: Face to face with him, as far as a woman could, (I wish you had seen her Juno: you would have been kinder to her) she fought him, but how could a girl win, and who is more powerful than Jove? Victorious, Jupiter made for the furthest reaches of the sky: while to Callisto the grove was odious and the wood seemed knowing

title: metamorphoses
text: As she retraced her steps she almost forgot her quiver and its arrows, and the bow she had left hanging

title: metamorphoses
text: Behold how Diana, with her band of huntresses, approaching from the heights of Maenalus, magnificent from the kill, spies her there, and seeing her calls out

title: metamorphoses
text: At the shout she runs, afraid at first in case it is Jupiter disguised, but when she sees the other nymphs come forward she realises there is no trickery and joins their number

title: metamorphoses
text: Alas! How hard it is not to show one’s guilt in one’s face! She can scarcely lift her eyes from the ground, not as she used to be, wedded to her goddess’s side or first of the whole company, but is silent and by her blushing shows signs of her shame at being attacked

title: metamorphoses
text: Even if she were not herself virgin, Diana could sense her guilt in a thousand ways

title: metamorphoses
text: They say all the nymphs could feel it

title: metamorphoses
text: Nine crescent moons had since grown full when the goddess faint from the chase in her brother’s hot sunlight found a cool grove out of which a murmuring stream ran, winding over fine sand

title: metamorphoses
text: She loved the place and tested the water with her foot

title: metamorphoses
text: Pleased with this too she said ‘Any witness is far away, let’s bathe our bodies naked in the flowing water

title: metamorphoses
text: ’ The Arcadian girl blushed: all of them took off their clothes: one of them tried to delay: hesitantly the tunic was removed and there her shame was revealed with her naked body

title: metamorphoses
text: Terrified she tried to conceal her swollen belly

title: metamorphoses
text: Diana cried ‘Go, far away from here: do not pollute the sacred fountain!’ and the Moon-goddess commanded her to leave her band of followers

title: metamorphoses
text: The great Thunderer’s wife had known about all this for a long time and had held back her severe punishment until the proper time

title: metamorphoses
text: Now there was no reason to wait

title: metamorphoses
text: The girl had given birth to a boy, Arcas, and that in itself enraged Juno

title: metamorphoses
text: When she turned her angry eyes and mind to thought of him she cried out ‘Nothing more was needed, you adulteress, than your fertility, and your marking the insult to me by giving birth, making public my Jupiter’s crime

title: metamorphoses
text: You’ll not carry this off safely

title: metamorphoses
text: Now, insolent girl, I will take that shape away from you, that pleased you and my husband so much!’ At this she clutched her in front by the hair of her forehead and pulled her face forwards onto the ground

title: metamorphoses
text: Callisto stretched out her arms for mercy: those arms began to bristle with coarse black hairs: her hands arched over and changed into curved claws to serve as feet: and her face, that Jupiter had once praised, was disfigured by gaping jaws: and so that her prayers and words of entreaty might not attract him her power of speech was taken from her

title: metamorphoses
text: An angry, threatening growl, harsh and terrifying, came from her throat

title: metamorphoses
text: Still her former feelings remained intact though she was now a bear

title: metamorphoses
text: She showed her misery in continual groaning, raising such hands as she had left to the starry sky, feeling, though she could not speak it, Jupiter’s indifference

title: metamorphoses
text: Ah, how often she wandered near the house and fields that had once been her home, not daring to sleep in the lonely woods! Ah, how often she was driven among the rocks by the baying hounds, and the huntress fled in fear from the hunters! Often she hid at the sight of wild beasts forgetting what she was, and though a bear she shuddered at the sight of other bears on the mountains and feared the wolves though her father Lycaon ran with them

title: metamorphoses
text: And now Arcas, grandson of Lycaon, had reached his fifteenth year ignorant of his parentage

title: metamorphoses
text: While he was hunting wild animals, while he was finding suitable glades and penning up the Erymanthian groves with woven nets, he came across his mother, who stood still at sight of Arcas and appeared to know him

title: metamorphoses
text: He shrank back from those unmoving eyes gazing at him so fixedly, uncertain what made him afraid, and when she quickly came nearer he was about to pierce her chest with his lethal spear

title: metamorphoses
text: All-powerful Jupiter restrained him and in the same moment removed them and the possibility of that wrong, and together, caught up through the void on the winds, he set them in the heavens and made them similar constellations, the Great and Little Bear

title: metamorphoses
text: Juno was angered when she saw his inamorato shining among the stars, and went down into the waters to white-haired Tethys and old Oceanus to whom the gods often make reverence

title: metamorphoses
text: When they asked her the reason for her visit she began ‘You ask me why I, the queen of the gods, have left my home in the heavens to be here? Another has taken my place in the sky! I tell a lie, if you do not see, when night falls and the world darkens, newly exalted stars to wound me, set in the sky, where the remotest and shortest orbit circles the uttermost pole

title: metamorphoses
text: Why should anyone wish to avoid wounding Juno or dread my enmity if I only benefit those I harm? Oh what a great achievement! Oh what marvellous powers I have! I stopped her being human and she becomes a goddess! This is the punishment I inflict on the guilty! This is my wonderful sovereignty! Let him take away her animal form and restore her former beauty as he did before with that Argive girl, Io

title: metamorphoses
text: Why not divorce Juno, install her in my place, and let Lycaon be his father-in-law? If this contemptible insult to your foster-child moves you, shut out the seven stars of the Bear from your dark blue waters, repulse this constellation set in the heavens as a reward for her defilement, and do not let my rival dip in your pure flood!’

title: metamorphoses
text: The gods of the sea nodded their consent

title: metamorphoses
text: Then Saturnia, in her light chariot drawn by painted peacocks, drove up through the clear air

title: metamorphoses
text: These peacocks had only recently been painted, when Argus was killed, at the same time that your wings, Corvus, croaking Raven, were suddenly changed to black, though they were white before

title: metamorphoses
text: He was once a bird with silver-white plumage, equal to the spotless doves, not inferior to the geese, those saviours of the Capitol with their watchful cries, or the swan, the lover of rivers

title: metamorphoses
text: His speech condemned him

title: metamorphoses
text: Because of his ready speech he, who was once snow white, was now white’s opposite

title: metamorphoses
text: Coronis of Larissa was the loveliest girl in all Thessaly

title: metamorphoses
text: Certainly she pleased you, god of Delphi

title: metamorphoses
text: Well, as long as she was faithful, or not caught out

title: metamorphoses
text: But that bird of Phoebus discovered her adultery and, merciless informer, flew straight to his master to reveal the secret crime

title: metamorphoses
text: The garrulous Crow followed with flapping wings, wanting to know everything, but when he heard the reason, he said ‘This journey will do you no good: don’t ignore my prophecy! See what I was, see what I am, and search out the justice in it

title: metamorphoses
text: Truth was my downfall

title: metamorphoses
text: Once upon a time Pallas hid a child, Erichthonius, born without a human mother, in a box made of Actaean osiers

title: metamorphoses
text: She gave this to the three virgin daughters of two-natured Cecrops, who was part human part serpent, and ordered them not to pry into its secret

title: metamorphoses
text: Hidden in the light leaves that grew thickly over an elm-tree I set out to watch what they might do

title: metamorphoses
text: Two of the girls, Pandrosus and Herse, obeyed without cheating, but the third Aglauros called her sisters cowards and undid the knots with her hand, and inside they found a baby boy with a snake stretched out next to him

title: metamorphoses
text: That act I betrayed to the goddess

title: metamorphoses
text: And this is the reward I got for it, no longer consecrated to Minerva’s protection, and ranked below the Owl, that night-bird! My punishment should be a warning to all birds not to take risks by speaking out

title: metamorphoses
text: ‘And just think, not only had I not asked for her favour, she had sought me out, of her own accord! – Ask Pallas herself: though she is angry, she will not deny it even in anger

title: metamorphoses
text: The famous Coroneus was my father, in the land of Phocis (it is said to be well known) and I was a royal virgin and wealthy princes courted me (so do not disparage me)

title: metamorphoses
text: But my beauty hurt me

title: metamorphoses
text: Once when I was walking slowly as I used to do along the crest of the sands by the shore the sea-god saw me and grew hot

title: metamorphoses
text: When his flattering words and entreaties proved a waste of time, he tried force, and chased after me

title: metamorphoses
text: I ran, leaving the solid shore behind, tiring myself out uselessly in the soft sand

title: metamorphoses
text: Then I called out to gods and men

title: metamorphoses
text: No mortal heard my voice, but the virgin goddess feels pity for a virgin and she helped me

title: metamorphoses
text: I was stretching out my arms to the sky: those arms began to darken with soft plumage

title: metamorphoses
text: I tried to lift my cloak from my shoulders but it had turned to feathers with roots deep in my skin

title: metamorphoses
text: I tried to beat my naked breast with my hands but found I had neither hands nor naked breast

title: metamorphoses
text: I ran, and now the sand did not clog my feet as before but I lifted from the ground, and soon sailed high into the air

title: metamorphoses
text: So I became an innocent servant of Minerva

title: metamorphoses
text: But what use was that to me if Nyctimene, who was turned into an Owl for her dreadful sins, has usurped my place of honour? Or have you not heard the story all Lesbos knows well, how Nyctimene desecrated her father’s bed? Though she is now a bird she is conscious of guilt at her crime and flees from human sight and the light, and hides her shame in darkness, and is driven from the whole sky by all the birds

title: metamorphoses
text: To all this, the Raven replied ‘I pray any evil be on your own head

title: metamorphoses
text: I spurn empty prophecies’ and, completing the journey he had started, he told his master he had seen Coronis lying beside a Thessalian youth

title: metamorphoses
text: The laurel fell from the lover’s head on hearing of the charge, his expression and colour and the tone of his lyre changed, and his mind boiled with growing anger

title: metamorphoses
text: He seized his usual weapons, strung his bow bending it by the tips, and, with his unerring arrow, pierced the breast that had so often been close to his own

title: metamorphoses
text: She groaned at the wound, and as the arrow was drawn out her white limbs were drenched with scarlet blood and she cried out ‘Oh Phoebus it was in your power to have punished me, but to have let me give birth first: now two will die in one

title: metamorphoses
text: ’ She spoke, and then her life flowed out with her blood

title: metamorphoses
text: A deathly cold stole over her body, emptied of being

title: metamorphoses
text: Alas! Too late the lover repents of his cruel act, and hates himself for listening to the tale that has so angered him

title: metamorphoses
text: He hates the bird that has compelled him to know of the fault that brought him pain

title: metamorphoses
text: He hates the bow, his hand, and the hastily fired arrow as well as that hand

title: metamorphoses
text: He cradles the fallen girl and attempts to overcome fate with his healing powers

title: metamorphoses
text: It is too late, and he tries his arts in vain

title: metamorphoses
text: Later, when all efforts had failed, seeing the funeral pyre prepared to consume her body, then indeed the god groaned from the depths of his heart (since the faces of the heavenly gods cannot be touched by tears), groans no different from those of a young bullock, seeing the hammer poised at the slaughterer’s right ear, crash down on the hollow forehead of a suckling calf

title: metamorphoses
text: Even though she cannot know of it, the god pours fragrant incense over her breast, and embraces her body, and unjustly, performs the just rites

title: metamorphoses
text: He could not let a child of Phoebus be destroyed in the same ruin, and he tore his son, Aesculapius, from its mother’s womb and from the flames, and carried him to the cave of Chiron the Centaur, who was half man and half horse

title: metamorphoses
text: But he stopped the Raven, who had hoped for a reward for telling the truth, from living among the white birds

title: metamorphoses
text: The semi-human was pleased with this foster-child of divine origin, glad at the honour it brought him, when his daughter suddenly appeared, her shoulders covered with her long red hair, whom the nymph Chariclo called Ocyrhoë, having given birth to her on the banks of that swift stream

title: metamorphoses

text: The captain shouts: ‘Lower the yards, now, and close reef all sails

title: metamorphoses
text: ’ He shouts the order but the adverse wind drowns it, and his voice cannot be heard above the breaking seas

title: metamorphoses
text: Yet, some of the crew, on their own initiative, remove the oars, some protect the bulwarks, some deny the wind canvas-room

title: metamorphoses
text: Here one bails water back into the water, another secures the spars

title: metamorphoses
text: While these things are being done, randomly, the storm increases its severity, and the roaring winds attack from every quarter, stirring the angry waves

title: metamorphoses
text: The captain himself is fearful, and admits he does not know how things stand, what to order, what to prevent: such is the weight of destruction, so much more powerful than his skill

title: metamorphoses
text: There is uproar: men shouting, the rigging straining, the sound of the breaking sea from a weight of sea, and the crash of thunder

title: metamorphoses
text: The waves rise up and seem to form the sky, and their spray touches the lowering clouds

title: metamorphoses
text: Now the water is tainted yellow, with sand churned from the depths, now blacker than the Styx, while the waves break white with hissing foam

title: metamorphoses
text: The Trachinian ship is driven in the grip of fate, now lifted on high, as if looking down on the valleys from a mountain summit, into the depths of Acheron: now sinking, caught in the trough of the wave, staring at heaven from the infernal pool

title: metamorphoses
text: Again and again the force of the flood strikes the sides with a huge crash, sounding no lighter a blow than when, sometime, an iron ram, or a ballista, strikes a damaged fortress

title: metamorphoses
text: As fierce lions, on the attack, drive themselves onto the armoured chests and extended spears of the hunters, so the waves drove forward in the rising winds, reaching the height of the ship, and higher, above it

title: metamorphoses
text: And now the wooden wedges give way, and, stripped of their wax covering, cracks appear, offering the lethal waves a passage

title: metamorphoses
text: Look how the heavy rain falls from the melting clouds, and you would think the whole heaven was emptying into the sea, and the sea was filling the heavenly zones

title: metamorphoses
text: The sails are soaked with spray, and the seawater mingles with water from the heavens

title: metamorphoses
text: The sky is starless, and the murky night is full of its own and the storm’s gloom

title: metamorphoses
text: Flashes of lightning cleave it, and give light: the rain is illuminated by the lightning flares

title: metamorphoses
text: Now the sea pours into the ship’s hollow hull, as well

title: metamorphoses
text: As a soldier, more outstanding than the rest, who has often tried to scale the battlement of a besieged city, succeeds at last, and fired with a love of glory, takes the wall, one man in a thousand; so when the waves have battered nine times against the steep sides, the tenth wave surging with greater impetus rushes on, and does not cease its assault on the beleaguered craft, until it breaches the conquered vessel’s defences

title: metamorphoses
text: So one part of the sea is still trying to take the ship, and part is already inside

title: metamorphoses
text: All is confusion, as a city is confused when some are undermining the walls from outside, while others hold them from within

title: metamorphoses

title: metamorphoses

title: metamorphoses

title: metamorphoses
text: How he would like to see his native shores again, and turn his last gaze towards his home, but he knows not where it is: the sea swirls in such vortices, and the covering shadows of pitch-black clouds so hide the sky, that it mirrors the aspect of night

text: One ultimate wave, like a conqueror delighting in his spoils, rears up gazing down at the other waves, and, as if one tore Pindus, and Athos, from their base, and threw them utterly into the open sea, it fell headlong, and the weight and the impulse together, drove the ship to the bottom

title: metamorphoses

title: metamorphoses
text: Lucifer was indistinct, and not to be known, that dawn, and since he was not allowed to leave the sky, he covered his face in dense cloud

title: metamorphoses
text: Meanwhile, Alcyone, Aeolus’s daughter, counts the nights, unaware of this great misfortune, quickly weaving clothes for him to wear, and for herself, for when he returns, and she promises herself the homecoming that will not be

title: metamorphoses
text: She piously offers incense to all the gods, but worships mostly at Juno’s temple, coming to the altars for a man who is no more, hoping her husband is safe, and returning to her, preferring her above any other woman

title: metamorphoses

title: metamorphoses
text: The goddess could no longer bear these appeals for one who was dead, and, to free her altar from those inauspicious hands, she said: ‘Iris, most faithful carrier of my words, go quickly to the heavy halls of Sleep, and order him to send Alcyone a dream-figure in the shape of her dead Ceyx, to tell her his true fate

title: metamorphoses
text: ’ As she spoke, Iris donned her thousand-coloured robe, and, tracing her watery bow on the sky, she searched out, as ordered, the palace of that king, hid under cloud

title: metamorphoses
text: There is a deeply cut cave, a hollow mountain, near the Cimmerian country, the house and sanctuary of drowsy Sleep

title: metamorphoses
text: Phoebus can never reach it with his dawn, mid-day or sunset rays

title: metamorphoses
text: Clouds mixed with fog, and shadows of the half-light, are exhaled from the ground

title: metamorphoses
text: No waking cockerel summons Aurora with his crowing: no dog disturbs the silence with its anxious barking, or goose, cackling, more alert than a dog

title: metamorphoses
text: No beasts, or cattle, or branches in the breeze, no clamour of human tongues

title: metamorphoses
text: There still silence dwells

title: metamorphoses
text: But out of the stony depths flows Lethe’s stream, whose waves, sliding over the loose pebbles, with their murmur, induce drowsiness

title: metamorphoses
text: In front of the cave mouth a wealth of poppies flourish, and innumerable herbs, from whose juices dew-wet Night gathers sleep, and scatters it over the darkened earth

title: metamorphoses

title: metamorphoses

text: Around him, here and there, lie uncertain dreams, taking different forms, as many as the ears of corn at harvest, as the trees bear leaves, or grains of sand are thrown onshore

title: metamorphoses
text: The god, hardly able to lift his eyes heavy with sleep, again and again, falling back, striking his nodding chin on his chest, at last shook himself free of his own influence, and resting on an elbow asked her (for he knew her) why she had come, and she replied:

title: metamorphoses
text: ‘Sleep, all things’ rest: Sleep, gentlest of the gods, the spirit’s peace, whom care flies from: who soothes the body wearied with toil, and readies it for fresh labours: Sleep, order a likeness, that mirrors his true form, and let it go, the image of King Ceyx, to Alcyone, in Trachin of Hercules, and depict a phantasm of the wreck

title: metamorphoses
text: This, Juno commands

title: metamorphoses
text: After she had completed her commission, Iris departed, no longer able to withstand the power of sleep, and, feeling the drowsiness steal over her body, she fled, and re-crossed the arch by which she had lately come

title: metamorphoses
text: From a throng of a thousand sons, his father roused Morpheus, a master craftsman and simulator of human forms

title: metamorphoses
text: No one else is as clever at expressing the movement, the features, and the sound of speech

title: metamorphoses
text: He depicts the clothes and the usual accents

title: metamorphoses
text: He alone imitates human beings

title: metamorphoses

title: metamorphoses
text: The gods call him Icelos, the mortal crowd Phobetor

title: metamorphoses
text: The third, of diverse artistry, is Phantasos: he takes illusory shapes of all inanimate things, earth, stones, rivers, trees

title: metamorphoses

title: metamorphoses
text: Old Somnus passed them by, choosing one of all these brothers, Morpheus, to carry out the command of Iris, daughter of Thaumas, and relaxing again into sweet drowsiness, his head drooped and he settled into his deep bed

title: metamorphoses
text: Flying through the shadows on noiseless wings, Morpheus, after a short delay, comes to the Haemonian city

text: Shedding his wings, he takes the shape of Ceyx, pallid like the dead, and naked, and stands before his unfortunate wife’s bed

title: metamorphoses
text: He appears with sodden beard, and seawater dripping from his matted hair

title: metamorphoses
text: Then he bends over her pillow, with tears streaming down his face, and says: ‘My poor wife, do you know your Ceyx, or has my face altered in death? Look at me: you will recognise me, and find for a husband, a husband’s shade! Your prayers have brought me no help, Alcyone! I am dead! Do not hold out false hopes of my return! Storm-laden Auster, the south wind, caught the ship in Aegean waters, and tossed in tempestuous blasts, wrecked her there

title: metamorphoses

text: Get up, act, shed tears, wear mourning: do not let me go down unwept to Tartarus’s void

title: metamorphoses

title: metamorphoses
text: How good it would have been to have gone with you: then no part of my life would have lacked your presence, nor would we be separated by death

title: metamorphoses
text: Now I have died absent from myself, and am thrown through the waves, absently, and the sea takes me, without me

title: metamorphoses
text: My mind would treat me more cruelly than the sea, if I should try to live on, and fight to overcome my sorrow! But I shall not fight, nor leave you, my poor husband, and at least now I shall come as your companion

title: metamorphoses
text: If not the sepulchral urn the lettered stone will join us: if I shall not touch you, bone to my bone, still I will touch you, name to name

title: metamorphoses
text: And while she stayed there, and while she was saying: ‘Here he loosed the rope, on this strand he kissed me as he left,’ and while she recalled the significant actions by their locations, and looked seawards, she saw in the flowing waves what looked like a body, unsure at first what it was: after the tide had brought it a little nearer, though it was some way off, it was clearly a body

title: metamorphoses
text: She did not know whose it was, but was moved by the omen of this shipwrecked man, and as if she wept for the unknown dead, she cried out: ‘Alas for you, poor soul, whoever you may be, and your wife, if you have one!’ The body had been washed nearer by the sea, and the more she gazed at it, the smaller and smaller shrank her courage: woe! Now it was close to land, now she could see who it was: it was her husband! She cried out: ‘It’s him!’ and together tearing at cheeks, and hair, and clothes she stretched out her trembling hands to Ceyx, saying: ‘O, is it like this, dear husband, is it like this, wretched one, you return to me?’

text: Even now, there is a rumour that Rome, of the Dardanians, is rising, by Tiber’s waters, born in the Apennines, and laying, beneath its mass, the foundation of great things

title: metamorphoses
text: So, growing, it changes form, and one day will be the capital of a whole world! So, it is said, the seers predict, and the oracles that tell our fate

title: metamorphoses
text: As I remember also, when the Trojan State was falling, Helenus, son of Priam, said to a weeping Aeneas, who was unsure of his future: “Son of the goddess, if you take careful heed, of what my mind prophesies, Troy will not wholly perish while you live! title: metamorphoses
text: I see, even now, a city, destined for Phrygian descendants, than which none is greater, or shall be, or has been, in past ages

text: Other leaders will make her powerful, through the long centuries, but one, born of the blood of Iülus, will make her mistress of the world

text: When earth has benefited from him, the celestial regions will enjoy him, and heaven will be his goal

title: metamorphoses
text: These things, I remember well, Helenus prophesied for Aeneas, as Aeneas carried the ancestral gods, and I am glad that the walls, of his descendants, are rising, and that the Greeks conquered to a Trojan’s gain

title: metamorphoses
text: ‘Now (lest I stray too far off course, my horses forgetting to aim towards their goal), the heavens, and whatever is under them, change their form, and the earth, and whatever is within it

title: metamorphoses

title: metamorphoses
text: We should allow those beings to live in safety, and honour, that the spirits of our parents, or brothers, or those joined to us by some other bond, certainly human, might have inhabited: and not fill our bellies as if at a Thyestean feast! What evil they contrive, how impiously they prepare to shed human blood itself, who rip at a calf’s throat with the knife, and listen unmoved to its bleating, or can kill a kid to eat that cries like a child, or feed on a bird, that they themselves have fed! How far does that fall short of actual murder? Where does the way lead on from there?

title: metamorphoses
text: Let the ox plough, or owe his death to old age: let the sheep yield wool, to protect against the chill north wind: let the she-goats give you full udders for milking! title: metamorphoses
text: Kill them, if they harm you, but even then let killing be enough

text: Let your mouth be free of their blood, enjoy milder food!’

title: metamorphoses

title: metamorphoses
